Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well. I actually tried to engage in conversations like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
I managed to talk to four different people at a gathering. It felt really good!
Wow, that’s impressive! What kind of conversations did you have?
I asked about their travel experiences and even shared some of my own. It was nice to connect.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re making great progress. Did you feel any anxiety during those conversations?
A little at first, but it faded once I started talking.
That’s a sign of growth! It sounds like you’re becoming more comfortable in social situations.
Yes, I think so!
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or feelings since practicing these conversations?
I feel more confident and less shy overall.
That’s great! Confidence can have a positive ripple effect on many areas of life. Have you set any new goals for yourself?
I want to keep practicing and maybe even join a local club or group.
That’s an excellent goal! What kind of club or group are you considering?
I was thinking about a book club since I love reading.
That sounds like a perfect fit! Book clubs can provide a great way to meet new people. Have you looked into any specific ones yet?
I found a couple online that meet monthly. I’m thinking of attending the next one.
That’s exciting! How do you feel about attending?
I’m a bit nervous, but I’m also looking forward to it.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous. What can you do to prepare for it?
I’ll read the book beforehand and maybe write down some thoughts to share.
Excellent strategy! That’ll give you confidence when discussing it with others.
Yes, I think it will help.
Last time, we talked about managing stress. Have you had a chance to incorporate some yoga or meditation into your routine?
Yes, I started doing yoga in the mornings, and it’s been really helpful.
That’s fantastic! How do you feel after your yoga sessions?
I feel more relaxed and focused throughout the day.
That’s wonderful to hear! Consistent practice can significantly reduce stress. Have you noticed any situations where you’ve applied that relaxation?
Yes, I felt calmer during a stressful meeting at work last week.
That’s a great application of your practice! It sounds like you’re developing resilience.
I hope so!
Is there anything specific you’d like to work on regarding stress management or any other areas?
I’d like to learn more about mindfulness techniques to help me stay present.
Mindfulness can be very beneficial. Would you like to try a simple mindfulness exercise together?
Sure, I’d love that!
Let’s take a moment to focus on our breath. Inhale deeply through your nose, hold it for a moment, and then exhale slowly through your mouth.
(pauses) Okay, that feels nice.
Great! You can do this for a few minutes whenever you feel overwhelmed. How did that feel for you?
It felt calming. I think I can incorporate this into my daily routine.
That’s wonderful! Mindfulness can help anchor you in the present moment. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I think we covered everything I wanted to discuss.
Perfect! I’m so proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s continue to build on these skills in our next session.
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I look forward to hearing about your experiences next time.
Bye!
